page.title: 17DISUSED CHALK PITS
page.content: On the chalk downs of Arreton and Mersley along their southern scarp faces are twelve disused chalk pits, the largest being the Downend Chalk Pit. Chalk was formerly quarried in these pits and used locally as a dressing on both the heavy clay soils and on the lighter soils. The chalk was also used for lime-wash and plaster and one lane in the south west of the block derives its name from the lime kiln used for this: namely Lime Kiln Shute. The pits today are scars on the landscape, some being used as "dumping" grounds, others are overgrown and dangerous.
